titles.title: Thou Sweet Beloved Will of God

comments.comment: This hymnal has not been proofed - data may be incomplete or incorrect

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Thou sweet beloved will of God, my anchor ground, my fortress hill, my spirit’s silent fair abode, in thee I hide me and am still.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: O will, that willest good alone, lead thou the way, thou guidest best; a little child, I follow on, and trusting, lean upon thy breast.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: God’s will doth make the bitter sweet, and all is well when it is done; unless His will doth hallow it, the glory of all joy is gone.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Self, sense, and reason, they may scorn that hidden way that leads on high-- still be my deepest will uptorn, and so the pow'r of nature die.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: And if in gloom I see thee not, I lean upon thy love unknown-- in me thy blessèd will is wrought, if I will nothing of my own.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: O spirit of a little child, Of will bereft, untroubled, pure, I seek thy glory undefiled; Lord, take my will, Thy love is sure.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: O will of God, my soul’s desire, my bread of life in want and pain; O will of God, my guiding fire, unite my will to thine again.

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: O will, in me thy work be done, for time, and for eternity-- give joy or sorrow, all are one to that blest soul that loveth thee.
